text: The Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir is the head of state of the Union territory of Jammu and Kashmir. == List of rulers of Jammu and Kashmir == This is a list of rulers of State of Jammu and Kashmir from 1846 to 1952 CE. Ruler Portrait Reign Maharaja Gulab Singh 16 March 1846 – 20 February 1856 Maharaja Ranbir Singh 20 February 1856 – 12 September 1885 Maharaja Pratap Singh 12 September 1885 – 23 September 1925 Maharaja Hari Singh 12 September 1925 – 17 November 1952 == Sadr-e-Riyasat of Jammu and Kashmir == # Name Term of office Took office Left office Time in office 1 Karan Singh == Governors of Jammu and Kashmir == # Name Term of office Term of office Term of office # Name Took office Left office Time in office 1 Karan Singh (total: 14 years, 179 days) 2 Bhagwan Sahay 3 L. K. Jha 4 B. K. Nehru 5 Jagmohan Malhotra 6 Gen. K. V. Krishna Rao (5) Jagmohan Malhotra (total: 5 years, 203 days) 7 Girish Chandra Saxena (6) Gen. K. V. Krishna Rao (total: 5 years, 243 days) (7) Girish Chandra Saxena (total: 7 years, 365 days) 8 S. K. Sinha 9 N. N. Vohra 10 Satya Pal Malik Jammu and Kashmir state partitioned on 31 October 2019 Janki Nath Wazir was acting governor after Karan Singh for two months, and Vazhakkulangarayil Khalid was acting governor for 12 days. ==List== # Name Portrait Took Office Left Office Appointed by Ref 1 Girish Chandra Murmu 31 October 2019 6 August 2020 Ram Nath Kovind 2 Manoj Sinha 7 August 2020 Incumbent Ram Nath Kovind ==Notes== ==References==
title: List of lieutenant governors of Jammu and Kashmir
